claim: The HUC 8 highlighted in red in panel a is depicted in Figure 3.The inherent nestedness of the dataset can be used to examine the spatial pattern of confluence conditions across a range of spatial scales, from the spatial pattern for HUC 8 units across the country (Figure 2) to HUC 12 units nested in HUC 8 units (Figure 3b) to individual confluences within HUC 12 units (Figure 3a).
title: FIGURE 3.
caption: Spatial distribution of (a) confluence conditions for a HUC 12 and (b) the proportion of confluences in good ecological condition for the HUC 12 units nested within a HUC 8. The HUC 12 highlighted in (b) is depicted in (a). The confluence encircled in black in (a) is discussed in the Results. The HUC 8 in (b) is highlighted in Figure 2. The Google Earth™ image date is February 2, 2019.

claim: There was often considerable spatial variability in confluences conditions within the HUC 12 units that comprise a HUC 8 (e.g., Figures 2a vs. 3b) and there was often considerable spatial variability in confluence conditions within the HUC 12 units themselves (e.g., Figure 3a vs. 3b).
title: FIGURE 3.
caption: Spatial distribution of (a) confluence conditions for a HUC 12 and (b) the proportion of confluences in good ecological condition for the HUC 12 units nested within a HUC 8. The HUC 12 highlighted in (b) is depicted in (a). The confluence encircled in black in (a) is discussed in the Results. The HUC 8 in (b) is highlighted in Figure 2. The Google Earth™ image date is February 2, 2019.

claim: The scale of individual confluences is often the scale at which restoration occurs because of cost factors (Wickham, Riitters, et al. 2017) and an interesting example of how the data could be used to support local ecological restoration efforts is represented by the confluence encircled in black in Figure 3a.
title: FIGURE 3.
caption: Spatial distribution of (a) confluence conditions for a HUC 12 and (b) the proportion of confluences in good ecological condition for the HUC 12 units nested within a HUC 8. The HUC 12 highlighted in (b) is depicted in (a). The confluence encircled in black in (a) is discussed in the Results. The HUC 8 in (b) is highlighted in Figure 2. The Google Earth™ image date is February 2, 2019.

claim: The Google Earth™ image date is February 2, 2019.Across the conterminous U.S., about 20% (n = 196,818) of the confluences were hydraulically significant, and their distribution across the clusters was uneven (Figure 4).
title: FIGURE 4.
caption: Confluence condition where symmetry (Ws) ratio ≥0.6 and inflowing stream orders >1.

claim: Depending on the objectives, our emphasis on generality may or may not impact the use of these data at local scales (e.g., Figure 3a).
title: FIGURE 3.
caption: Spatial distribution of (a) confluence conditions for a HUC 12 and (b) the proportion of confluences in good ecological condition for the HUC 12 units nested within a HUC 8. The HUC 12 highlighted in (b) is depicted in (a). The confluence encircled in black in (a) is discussed in the Results. The HUC 8 in (b) is highlighted in Figure 2. The Google Earth™ image date is February 2, 2019.

claim: Our results for hydrologic significance for stream orders greater than one (i.e., Figure 4) could also be affected if the inclusion of headwaters changed the spatial pattern of stream orders.
title: FIGURE 4.
caption: Confluence condition where symmetry (Ws) ratio ≥0.6 and inflowing stream orders >1.

claim: The inherent nestedness of the dataset can be used to examine the spatial pattern of confluence conditions across a range of spatial scales, from the spatial pattern for HUC 8 units across the country (Figure 2) to HUC 12 units nested in HUC 8 units (Figure 3b) to individual confluences within HUC 12 units (Figure 3a).

caption: Spatial distribution of (a) confluence conditions for a HUC 12 and (b) the proportion of confluences in good ecological condition for the HUC 12 units nested within a HUC 8. claim: Across the conterminous U.S., about 20% (n = 196,818) of the confluences were hydraulically significant, and their distribution across the clusters was uneven (Figure 4).

caption: Confluence condition where symmetry (Ws) ratio ≥0.6 and inflowing stream orders >1.
